ref: 2541 ṓjas n. ʻ strength, vigour, vitality ʼ RV. [√*vaj]
Pa. ōjā -- f. ʻ nutritive element in food ʼ (for gender cf. ūrjā́ -- );
Pk. ōya -- n., ōyā -- f. ʻ strength, fame, glory ʼ,

lang: MIA. forms occurring in Corpus Inscriptionum Indicarum Vol. II Pt. 1
Language of `Kharoṣṭhī Inscriptions discovered by Sir Aurel Stein in Chinese Turkestan' edited by A. M. Boyer, E. J. Rapson, and E. Senart
